parenting_crisis_universal.introduction.msg_list:
You are not alone ü§≤. Many other people are also going through very hard times, including war or having to leave their home üíî. Many people share your pain as you face so many losses and uncertainties.

When life is this hard, it's normal to feel overwhelmed üò£.

The first tip is about ways you can take care of yourself üå±, even when it is very difficult.
parenting_crisis_universal.importance.msg_list: Remember, when you take good care of yourself, it can help you take good care of your children.
parenting_crisis_universal.quiz.content.1.question: Over the last week, how often have you been bothered by feeling down, depressed, or hopeless?
parenting_crisis_universal.quiz.content.1.values: Not at all|Several days|More than half the days|Nearly every day|I don't want to answer
parenting_crisis_universal.quiz.content.2.question: Over the last week, how often have you been bothered by little interest or pleasure in doing things?
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.message.1.text:
1Ô∏è‚É£ **BREATHE**

Listen to your breath üå¨Ô∏è as it goes in and out.
Place your hands on your tummy and feel how it rises and falls with each breath.
Then, listen to your breath in a calm, gentle way üåÑ for a while.
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.message.2.text:
2Ô∏è‚É£ **BREATHE TOGETHER WITH YOUR CHILDREN**

 üóìÔ∏è Do these breathing practices every day along with your children. It will help you and them learn stress management üå±.
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.message.3.text:
3Ô∏è‚É£ **CONNECT**

If your stress feels overwhelming, please contact a trusted person, organisation or helpline. Type {HELP} for more information.
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.message.4.text:
4Ô∏è‚É£ **SHARE WITH OTHERS**

In these situations, you can feel scared or upset but sharing your sorrow and worries with someone you trust often helps lighten the burden.
parenting_crisis_universal.video.message:
Press Play ‚ñ∂Ô∏è to learn 4Ô∏è‚É£ tips to help you care for yourself so you can care for your children: 
1Ô∏è‚É£ **BREATHE**
2Ô∏è‚É£ **BREATHE TOGETHER WITH YOUR CHILDREN**
3Ô∏è‚É£ **CONNECT**
4Ô∏è‚É£ *SHARE WITH OTHERS**
parenting_crisis_universal.congratulations.msg_list:
üíô Thank you for joining us today. You are undoubtedly great.
Coping with your fears and stress üåä is the first step to helping yourself üí™ and helping others ü§ù.

parenting_crisis_universal.introduction.msg_list:
In these times, it can be hard for us as parents to help our children feel secure.

Today's tip is about helping your children cope with trauma from war, displacement, and other hardships üåçüíî.
parenting_crisis_universal.importance.msg_list:
It is possible that your children are feeling upset, angry, or confused. They need your support.

There are some small things you can do! üåü
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.intro: Here are 5Ô∏è‚É£ tips on how you can support your children with the traumas of war, displacement and other tough times:
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.message.1.text:
1Ô∏è‚É£ **LISTEN**

üëÇ Listen to your children carefully when they express their feelings and try to empathise.
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.message.2.text:
2Ô∏è‚É£ **ACCEPT & BE SENSITIVE**

üå± Accept whatever they are feeling and give them comfort that such feelings are quite normal under these circumstances.

üõë If your child does not want to talk about this situation, do not insist.
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.message.3.text:
3Ô∏è‚É£ **BE HONEST**

If your child asks a question about what is happening, be honest in your response and share information that is appropriate for their age.

Try to have a compassionate attitude and accept any feelings they have.
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.message.4.text:
4Ô∏è‚É£ **PRAISE YOURSELF AND YOUR CHILDREN**

üåü Every night, praise yourself and your children for something, however small. 

This will make you and your children feel better and will help build a caring relationship between you ü¶ã.
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.message.5.text:
5Ô∏è‚É£ **THERE IS HELP**

ü§ùIf you have any concerns regarding a child‚Äôs feelings and behaviours, then please contact a trusted person, organisation, or helpline. Type {HELP} after this lesson, or any time you need help, for more information.
parenting_crisis_universal.video.message:
Press Play ‚ñ∂Ô∏è to learn 5Ô∏è‚É£ tips on how you can support your children with the traumas of war, displacement and other tough times: 
1Ô∏è‚É£ **LISTEN**
2Ô∏è‚É£ **ACCEPT & BE SENSITIVE**
3Ô∏è‚É£ **BE HONEST**
4Ô∏è‚É£ **PRAISE YOURSELF AND YOUR CHILDREN**
5Ô∏è‚É£ **THERE IS HELP**
parenting_crisis_universal.congratulations.msg_list: Thank you for joining us today üíô. No matter how upset or tired you are, you are amazing parents.

parenting_crisis_universal.module_name: Spending Time With Children to Cope
parenting_crisis_universal.introduction.msg_list: Today's tip is about practical ways to cope with your current situation.
parenting_crisis_universal.importance.msg_list: Even though it‚Äôs hard, try to practise small daily habits üóìÔ∏è, because routines help children feel secure.
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.intro: Here are 5Ô∏è‚É£ practical, daily habits you can do every day that will help you and your children cope with your current situation:
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.message.1.text:
1Ô∏è‚É£ **SPEND TIME TOGETHER**

If it is possible, try to make a routine for spending time together üïí. 

üîÅ You can engage children in daily activities, such as telling a story, praying together, or sharing at least one meal together.
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.message.2.text:
2Ô∏è‚É£ **ASK YOUR CHILD**

When you do spend time together, ask children what they want to do. 

If you can‚Äôt do that activity now, it‚Äôs still a chance to connect with your child emotionally ü§ç.

After this lesson, you can type {PLAY} to get some activity ideas to do with children üìù.
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.message.3.text:
3Ô∏è‚É£ **APPRECIATE YOUR CHILDREN**

Take a moment every day to appreciate your children for engaging in activities with you üåø.
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.message.4.text:
4Ô∏è‚É£ **HELP OTHERS**

Helping others can also make you feel better ü§ç. Even a smile can help someone else feel better üå±.

Our children can learn calmness and kindness from us üíô.
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.message.5.text:
5Ô∏è‚É£ **BE PRESENT**

Be present, when possible, listen to them üëÇ, look at them üëÄ.  

Pay your full attention to them, this will help validate, reassure, and comfort children ü§ç.
parenting_crisis_universal.video.message:
Press Play ‚ñ∂Ô∏è to learn 5Ô∏è‚É£ practical, daily habits you can do every day that will help you and your children cope with your current situation:  
1Ô∏è‚É£ **SPEND TIME TOGETHER**
2Ô∏è‚É£ **ASK YOUR CHILD**
3Ô∏è‚É£ **APPRECIATE YOUR CHILDREN**
4Ô∏è‚É£ **HELP OTHERS**
5Ô∏è‚É£ **BE PRESENT**
parenting_crisis_universal.comic.intro: Here are some regular activities you might want to try to do with your children:
parenting_crisis_universal.congratulations.msg_list:
Thank you for joining us üíô. 

Our children learn to show peace, love, and empathy from us üåø.  

Playing and talking to children every day helps them feel secure üõ°Ô∏è. You‚Äôre doing so much to care for your children! üåü

parenting_crisis_universal.introduction.msg_list:
In these times that are so hard, we often have extra stress and tension, and it‚Äôs normal that we feel more anger. 

This tip suggests ways you can stay calm and also encourage your children during times of uncertainty üå±.
parenting_crisis_universal.importance.msg_list:
In case of any uncertainty, children observe and imitate behaviours of their elders üëÄ.

Children can learn calm from us, which helps them face challenges üå∏.
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.intro: Here are 4Ô∏è‚É£ tips that can help you cope with negative emotions and also encourage your children:
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.message.1.text:
1Ô∏è‚É£ **SHARE YOUR FEELINGS**

When you are feeling stress, tension or anger, find someone whom you can share your feelings with, like a trusted person or friend.

Avoid substance abuse as a stress coping mechanism. 
 
Instead, if your stress feels overwhelming, you can also contact an organization or helpline. Type {CONTACT} for more information.

ü§≤.
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.message.2.text:
2Ô∏è‚É£ **BREATHE**

When you feel extremely angry, take a 10-second break/pause before you engage with anyone, including your children ‚è∏Ô∏è.
Take deep breaths five times üå¨Ô∏è.
Then try to respond in a comparatively calmer way üïäÔ∏è.
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.message.3.text:
3Ô∏è‚É£ **REASSURE YOUR CHILD**
It‚Äôs ok to show your concern and emotions to your child üí¨. This will help them learn about their own emotions. It‚Äôs also good to remind them that we believe that one day hope and justice will prevail ‚ú®.

Reassure your child that one day, war will end, and our community will be able to rebuild and thrive together üåø.
Share stories with them of how people in the past have worked together and come out of traumatic situations üìñ.
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.message.4.text:
4Ô∏è‚É£ **THERE ARE PEOPLE WHO CARE**

Assure your child that friends, relatives, or charitable organisations will try to find ways to help them in these situations ü§≤.
parenting_crisis_universal.video.message:
Press Play ‚ñ∂Ô∏è to learn 4Ô∏è‚É£ tips that can help you cope with negative emotions while encouraging children: 
1Ô∏è‚É£ **SHARE YOUR FEELINGS**
2Ô∏è‚É£ **BREATHE**
3Ô∏è‚É£ **REASSURE YOUR CHILD**
4Ô∏è‚É£ **THERE ARE PEOPLE WHO CARE**
parenting_crisis_universal.congratulations.msg_list: Thank you for being here with us today. Be proud of yourself every time you cope with your anger and encourage your children. You are an amazing parent!

parenting_crisis_universal.introduction.msg_list: In this tip, we will talk about some simple safety plans you can make with your children üìù.
parenting_crisis_universal.importance.msg_list: It can help your children when they see that you have plans üíô.
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.intro: Here are 5Ô∏è‚É£ tips to help you plan for safety with your children:
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.message.1.text:
1Ô∏è‚É£ **PROTECT YOUR DOCUMENTS **

Make pictures or copies of any identity documents or cards and hide these in separate secure places.
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.message.2.text:
2Ô∏è‚É£ **HIDE MONEY**

Also hide any money you have separately in different places, so that if anything is lost, you won‚Äôt lose everything.
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.message.3.text:
3Ô∏è‚É£ **KEEP CHILDREN WITH YOU OR WITH TRUSTWORTHY PEOPLE**

Try your best to keep children with you or someone you trust.
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.message.4.text:
4Ô∏è‚É£ **COMMUNICATE WITH YOUR CHILD**

Tell your children they should not spend time outside alone after dark or take a lift with someone alone.
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.message.5.text:
5Ô∏è‚É£ **SUPERVISE YOUR CHILDREN**

Make sure you know that the people your children spend time with in person and online are trustworthy.
parenting_crisis_universal.video.message:
Press Play ‚ñ∂Ô∏è to learn 5Ô∏è‚É£ tips to help you get ready to travel with children in a crisis situation: 
1Ô∏è‚É£ **PROTECT YOUR DOCUMENTS**
2Ô∏è‚É£ **HIDE MONEY**
3Ô∏è‚É£ **KEEP CHILDREN WITH YOU OR WITH TRUSTWORTHY PEOPLE**
4Ô∏è‚É£ **COMMUNICATE WITH YOUR CHILD**
5Ô∏è‚É£ **SUPERVISE YOUR CHILDREN**
parenting_crisis_universal.congratulations.msg_list: Thank you for joining us today. Praise yourself for doing the best you can.

parenting_crisis_universal.introduction.msg_list: In this tip, we will talk about ways you can be prepared to travel safely with your children.
parenting_crisis_universal.importance.msg_list: Your child will feel reassured knowing you have a plan.
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.intro: Here are 3Ô∏è‚É£ things you can do to ensure that you and your children are as safe as possible when you are on the move:
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.message.1.text:
1Ô∏è‚É£ **MOVE SAFELY**

üîí Travel in a group of people you know, and don‚Äôt give any ID documents or cards to anyone, where possible.
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.message.2.text:
2Ô∏è‚É£ **PREPARE YOUR CHILDREN**

üéµMake a song or chant with your child so they memorise your full name and phone number, and number of someone you trust. üîÅ Go over it every day.

üìçEvery day, agree on a clear place to meet if you are separated from each other.
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.message.3.text:
3Ô∏è‚É£ **MAKE A SAFETY NOTE**

üóíÔ∏è Make a safety note for each child.
Write the full name & phone number of you and three people you trust, plus any medication your child needs and any special needs they have. 

Cover the note in plastic and hide it in something they always wear.
parenting_crisis_universal.video.message:
Press Play ‚ñ∂Ô∏è to learn 3 things you can do to ensure that you and your children are as safe as possible when you are on the move:

1Ô∏è‚É£ **MOVE SAFELY**
2Ô∏è‚É£ **PREPARE YOUR CHILDREN**
3Ô∏è‚É£ **MAKE A SAFETY NOTE**
parenting_crisis_universal.congratulations.msg_list: Thank you for joining us üíô. You are being prepared ‚Äì we are proud of you üåü.

parenting_crisis_universal.introduction.msg_list:
Today's tip is about protecting our children from harassment. 

During difficult times, children are more likely to face harassment.
parenting_crisis_universal.importance.msg_list: Talking to children about these things can help keep them safe. üõ°Ô∏è
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.intro: Here are 3Ô∏è‚É£ tips for protecting your child from harassment:
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.message.1.text:
1Ô∏è‚É£ **NO IS OK!**

Teach your children that nobody has the right to touch them.

In order to stop someone who tries to do that, practice saying and shouting ‚ÄúNO‚Äù with your children.
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.message.2.text:
2Ô∏è‚É£ **TEACH YOUR CHILD**

Talk to your children about dangerous people and places. Make plans together about how to avoid danger.
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.message.3.text:
3Ô∏è‚É£ **COMFORT YOUR CHILD**

If your child tells you they were abused, always believe them. 
Tell them that it‚Äôs not their fault and you love them.

You can type {HELP} for resources if your child shares about abuse with you.
parenting_crisis_universal.video.message:
Press Play ‚ñ∂Ô∏è to learn 3Ô∏è‚É£ tips for protecting your child from harassment: 
1Ô∏è‚É£ **NO IS OK!**
2Ô∏è‚É£ **TEACH YOUR CHILDREN**
3Ô∏è‚É£ **COMFORT YOUR CHILD**
parenting_crisis_universal.congratulations.msg_list: Thank you for joining us üíô. Remember that talking to children about these things helps keep them safe.

parenting_crisis_universal.module_name: Helping Your Child In Case Of Death Of Loved Ones
parenting_crisis_universal.introduction.msg_list:
This tip is about helping your children in the case of loved ones dying. 

Losing a loved one is painful for everyone, including children. 

It is possible that your children appear to be happy but deep inside are sad.
parenting_crisis_universal.importance.msg_list: Talking to your children about death can be hard, but it will help them make sense of what is happening.
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.intro: Here are 5Ô∏è‚É£ tips on how to help your children when loved ones die:
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.message.1.text:
1Ô∏è‚É£ **TALK WITH CHILDREN** 

Children often sense the pain of loss or death, even if they don't know yet what happened. Tell them in simple and honest words that the person has passed away. Be sensitive to their emotions and try to create a compassionate space when you talk with them about the death of loved ones.
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.message.2.text:
2Ô∏è‚É£ **LISTEN AND ACCEPT**

Listen to your children, accept anything they are feeling, and show them affection.
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.message.3.text:
3Ô∏è‚É£ **SAY GOODBYE**

Do something together to say goodbye to the person ‚Äì consider a prayer or a letter.
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.message.4.text:
4Ô∏è‚É£ **NO BLAMING**

Sometimes we feel like loss is our fault, even when it is not, and children may feel this way, too. Many people have these feelings. Remind yourself it‚Äôs not your fault, and help your children see it‚Äôs not their fault either.
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.message.5.text:
5Ô∏è‚É£ **BE CLEAR**
Tell children clearly who will be taking care of them now if a change needs to happen.
parenting_crisis_universal.video.message:
Here are 5Ô∏è‚É£ tips on how to help your children when loved ones die:
1Ô∏è‚É£ **TALK WITH CHILDREN** 
2Ô∏è‚É£ **LISTEN AND ACCEPT**
3Ô∏è‚É£ **SAY GOODBYE**
4Ô∏è‚É£ **NO BLAMING**
5Ô∏è‚É£ **BE CLEAR**
parenting_crisis_universal.comic.intro: Let us understand how children of different ages react to death so we can support them.
parenting_crisis_universal.comic.text.1: Small children under the age of 5 years may ask if the person who has died is coming back.
parenting_crisis_universal.comic.text.2: They might hold onto you or other caregivers more or start doing things they used to do when they were younger, like wetting the bed.
parenting_crisis_universal.comic.text.3: Older children between 6 and 11 years old may ask more questions and want to understand what happened.
parenting_crisis_universal.comic.text.4: They may show their grief through anger and experience physical aches or pains.
parenting_crisis_universal.comic.text.5: Adolescents and young teenagers from around the age of 12 years will wonder about why things happen.
parenting_crisis_universal.comic.text.6: Their reactions will vary and can include lack of interest, anger, extreme sadness and poor concentration.
parenting_crisis_universal.congratulations.msg_list:
Thank you for joining us. 

If your grief feels overwhelming, contact a trusted person, organisation or helpline by typing {CONTACT}.

Take some moments for yourself to grieve for your losses. Grieving is the pathway to healing for you and your children.

parenting_crisis_universal.introduction.msg_list: Congratulations on reaching our final set of tips! üéâ Here we are talking about ways to build your strength and your children‚Äôs strength and to encourage good behaviours in them.
parenting_crisis_universal.importance.msg_list: Even in these times that are so hard, there is hope that you can build strength, and when your children sense your love and appreciation, it helps them build their own strength, too. ü¶ã
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.intro: Here are 3Ô∏è‚É£ simple tips that can help you to encourage your children to build strength:
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.message.1.text:
1Ô∏è‚É£ **INVOLVE YOUR CHILDREN**

Ask children to help in simple chores. This will give them a sense of responsibility.
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.message.2.text:
2Ô∏è‚É£ **APPRECIATE THEM**

Appreciate children when they are trying or doing something good.

This will help them to do good again.
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.message.3.text:
3Ô∏è‚É£ **PRAISE THEM**

Praising children shows them that you notice and care and helps build confidence.
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.message.4.text:
You can also build your own strength by remembering that you are not alone and that sharing your sorrow and worries with someone you trust often helps lighten the burden. 

If your sorrow and worries feel overwhelming, please contact a trusted person, organisation or helpline. Type {CONTACT} for more information.
parenting_crisis_universal.video.message:
Press Play ‚ñ∂Ô∏è to learn 3Ô∏è‚É£ simple tips that can help you encourage your children to build strength:

1Ô∏è‚É£ **INVOLVE YOUR CHILDREN**
2Ô∏è‚É£ **APPRECIATE THEM**
3Ô∏è‚É£ **PRAISE THEM**
parenting_crisis_universal.congratulations.msg_list:
Thank you for being here with us today and for all our tips üíô. You are doing so much to care for yourself and your children. 

Remember that appreciating your children makes them realise that you give them attention and love ü§ç. You can be proud of yourself; you are truly great üåü!

take_a_pause.introduction.msg_list: Before we begin today's lesson, let's take a pause together. Remember, this is something you can do whenever you are feeling stressed.
take_a_pause.video.message:
Today's pause is called "Breath and Body Awareness".

Press ‚ñ∂Ô∏è to watch a video to practise taking a pause together
take_a_pause.audio.message:
Today's pause is called "Breath and Body Awareness".

Press ‚ñ∂Ô∏è to listen to an audio and practise taking a pause together
take_a_pause.tips.intro: Today's pause is called "Breath and Body Awareness".
take_a_pause.tips.message.1.text:
Start by taking a deep breath.
 
Notice how you are feeling emotionally. 

Notice how your body feels.
take_a_pause.tips.message.2.text:
Continue to take deep breaths.

Feel your breath as it goes in and out.

Notice any emotions you are feeling. Are there feelings of happiness, excitement, worry?

Whatever you are feeling is okay.
take_a_pause.tips.message.3.text:
Now, expand your awareness to your whole body. 

Listen to the sounds around you..
take_a_pause.tips.message.4.text:
Take a moment to reflect on whether you feel any different. 

When you are ready, continue to your lesson with a sense of calm.
take_a_pause.congratulations.msg_list: Thank you for taking a moment to pause with us. It's time for today's lesson.

take_a_pause.introduction.msg_list: Before we begin today's lesson, let's take a pause together. Remember, this is something you can do whenever you are feeling stressed.
take_a_pause.video.message:
Today's pause is called Checking-In.

Press ‚ñ∂Ô∏è to watch a video to practise taking a pause together
take_a_pause.audio.message:
Today's pause is called Checking-In.
Press ‚ñ∂Ô∏è to listen to an audio and practise taking a pause together
take_a_pause.tips.message.1.text:
Begin by taking a full breath in and a long breath out. 

Now bringing awareness to the top of your body, your head, face, neck, shoulders. 

Noticing any sensations, movements, any places of tension.
take_a_pause.tips.message.2.text:
Continue to scan your body, moving down the arms and hands and into your fingers. 


Sense the back of your body and your lower back.
take_a_pause.tips.message.3.text:
Feeling the contact of your body with the chair if you are seated. 

Now sensing your upper legs, your lower legs, and the feet.
take_a_pause.tips.message.4.text: Finish this pause by taking a full deep breath in and a long breath out.
take_a_pause.congratulations.msg_list: Thank you for taking a moment to pause with us. It's time for today's lesson.

take_a_pause.introduction.msg_list:
Before we begin today's lesson, let's take a pause together. 

Sometimes when we are experiencing stress or feeling alone, it can be helpful to send thoughts of loving kindness to ourselves.
take_a_pause.video.message:
Today's pause is called "Loving Kindness Meditation".

Press ‚ñ∂Ô∏è to watch a video to practise taking a pause together
take_a_pause.audio.message:
Today's pause is called "Loving Kindness Meditation".

Press ‚ñ∂Ô∏è to listen to an audio and practise taking a pause together
take_a_pause.tips.intro: Today's pause is called "Loving Kindness Meditation".
take_a_pause.tips.message.1.text:
Find a comfortable sitting position, your feet flat on the floor, your hands resting in your lap. 

Ask yourself, ‚ÄúWhat is my experience in this moment?‚Äù
take_a_pause.tips.message.2.text:
Notice what thoughts you are experiencing. 

Notice how you feel emotionally. 

Notice how your body feels. Notice any discomfort or tension.
take_a_pause.tips.message.3.text:
Connect to your heart in a kind and gentle way. You may want to place one hand on your heart or chest. 

You can then say the following words silently to yourself: 

May I be peaceful. 

May I be safe. 

May I be healthy. 

May I be happy. 

May I feel loved. 

Repeat slowly once or twice taking your time between each phrase.
take_a_pause.tips.message.4.text:
If you feel comfortable, you can also send thoughts of loving-kindness to your child, your spouse or fiance, your family, and anyone else who is close to you in your life.

Now, allow your focus to expand to the whole body. 

Allow your focus to expand to the sounds around you..
take_a_pause.congratulations.msg_list:
Take a moment to reflect on your experience. 

When you are ready, continue to today's lesson with a sense of calm. 

Thank you for taking a moment to pause with us.

take_a_pause.introduction.msg_list: Before we begin today's lesson, let's take a pause together. Remember, this is something you can do whenever you are feeling stressed.
take_a_pause.video.message:

take_a_pause.audio.message:
Today's pause is called "Slow Down and Breathe‚Äù.

Press ‚ñ∂Ô∏è to listen to an audio and practise taking a pause together
take_a_pause.tips.intro: Today's pause is called "Slow Down and Breathe".
take_a_pause.tips.message.1.text:
Wherever you are, become aware of how your body is being supported by the earth beneath you. 
Take note of how you are feeling. 

Bring your awareness to your breath
take_a_pause.tips.message.2.text:
Feel the air flowing in, and then flowing out. Start to slow down your exhale. Let it become longer than your inhale.

Breathe in to the count of four, and then slowly out to the count of six. 

If the counts are too long for you, go at your own pace!
take_a_pause.tips.message.4.text:
Let your breath return to normal and notice how you feel.  
Do you feel any different?
take_a_pause.congratulations.msg_list: Thank you for taking a moment to pause with us. It's time for today's lesson.
